botMessages.message: In what state are you based?
{!Deadline}
Please see here for deadlines for every state: https://studentaid.gov/apply-for-aid/fafsa/fafsa-deadlines.
Got another question?
Please see here for deadlines for every state: https://studentaid.gov/apply-for-aid/fafsa/fafsa-deadlines.

botDialogs.description: Version of the dialog used with V2 of the bot. This version does not yet implement the conversation experience design spec.
botDialogs.label: Check a deadline date

botMessages.message: Hi! I'm FAFSA Bot, a digital assistant. I'm here to help you with your questions while you fill out your FAFSA form.
What would you like to do?
Let's get you over to an agent who can help.
Thanks for taking the time to chat!
Click the "End Chat" button or exit out of this window to end this chat.
Sorry, I'm still learning, so I'm afraid I couldn't understand that...
Unfortunately, there are no agents available at the moment
I found the following articles
{!AnswerSelectedResult.Answer}
Was this useful?

botDialogs.description: Article Answers (Beta) can be used instead of the FAFSA Terms dialog
botDialogs.label: Article Answers

botMessages.message: Unfortunately, a system error occurred. I'll connect you to an agent who can help.
OK. You can check your eligibility here: https://fafsa.ed.gov/spa/fafsa4c/#/landing

botDialogs.description: Eligibility dialog per FAFSA conversation experience design document.
botDialogs.label: Learn if I qualify for financial aid

botMessages.message: Alright, happy to help.
I can explain financial terms that may be new to you found on the FAFSA form.
DEBUG: In FAFSA_Terms dialog. Article Answers should take over from here but should not go to the Confused dialog if the user has not yet typed in an input.

botDialogs.description: Lets Article Answers process the user input and provide an answer.
botDialogs.label: FAFSA Terms

botMessages.message: Alright, happy to help.
I can explain financial terms that may be new to you found on the FAFSA form.
What word would you like to learn about?

botDialogs.description: Clone of Article Answers (Beta) can be used instead of the FAFSA Terms dialog. Customized for Impact Labs FinAid Bot
botDialogs.label: Understand what a FAFSA word means

botMessages.message: What word would you like to learn about?

botDialogs.description: Prompts the user to enter some text when the system variable "[System] Answer Input (Text)" that hold user input is still empty. An example is when the Article Answer is invoked from a menu.
botDialogs.label: What word would you like to learn about?

botMessages.message: Can I assist you with anything else?

botQuickReplyOptions.literalValue: Yes - Take me back to the Main Menu
No - I'm all set for now

botDialogs.description: Asks the user of anything else before ending the chat. This is where most dialogs redirect to per conversation experience design specs.
botDialogs.label: Can I assist you with anything else?

botDialogs.description: Clears variables, usually before starting another dialog.
botDialogs.label: Clear memory

botMessages.message: OK, what question number on the FAFSA did you want help with?

botDialogs.description: Uses Article Answers to provide answers to questions about the FAFSA application form
botDialogs.label: Get help with a question on the FAFSA application

botMessages.message: Most students are eligible to receive financial aid from the federal government to help pay for college or career school.

Your age, race, or field of study won’t affect your eligibility for federal student aid. While your income is taken into consideration, it does not automatically prevent you from getting federal student aid.

Do you or will you have a high school diploma or GED certificate, or have you or will you have completed a high school education in a home school setting approved under state law? https://studentaid.gov/help-center/answers/topic/glossary/articles
I'm sorry, you don't meet the eligibility criteria. Please see more information here: https://studentaid.gov/resources/eligibility-text.
Are you enrolled or accepted for enrollment as a regular student in an eligible degree or certificate program? https://studentaid.gov/help-center/answers/topic/glossary/articles
I'm sorry, you don't meet the eligibility criteria. Please see more information here: https://studentaid.gov/resources/eligibility-text.
If you are a male, are you registered with Selective Service (you must register between the ages of 18 and 25)? If not a male select "Yes"
I'm sorry, you don't meet the eligibility criteria. Please see more information here: https://studentaid.gov/resources/eligibility-text.
Do you have a valid Social Security number? If you are from the Republic of the Marshall Islands, Federated States of Micronesia, or the Republic of Palau select "Yes"
I'm sorry, you don't meet the eligibility criteria. Please see more information here: https://studentaid.gov/resources/eligibility-text.

Are you not in default on a federal student loan and do not owe a refund on a federal grant and will you only use federal student aid for educational purposes? https://studentaid.gov/help-center/answers/topic/glossary/articles
I'm sorry, you don't meet the eligibility criteria. Please see more information here: https://studentaid.gov/resources/eligibility-text.
If enrolled, are you maintaining satisfactory academic progress in college or career school? If not yet enrolled select "Yes." https://studentaid.gov/help-center/answers/topic/glossary/articles
Are you a US Citizen or US National, have a Green Card, an Arrival-Departure Record, Battered Immigration Status, or have a T-VISA? https://studentaid.gov/resources/eligibility-text
I'm sorry, you don't meet the eligibility criteria. Please see more information here: https://studentaid.gov/resources/eligibility-text.
Congratulations, you are eligible to apply for the FAFSA! Go here to create an account: https://studentaid.gov/fsa-id/create-account/launch

botDialogs.description: V2 of the eligibility dialog. This version is not per conversation experience design document
botDialogs.label: Learn if I qualify for financial aid Copy
